@vseh1also  make sure to pop the car in sport mode or the gearbox into sport mode especially if it's a used car as the previous drivers may not be stepping hard so the TCU has learnt their patterns and has a slower kickdown. In sport  the gearbox will be more responsive.
I’ve never owned VW or Audi. But I test the A4 old models. Non turbo. I feel the engine is kinda coarse. Sounds rough like diesel.
They have come a long way in terms of refinement! Also for the older engines really depends on how they are maintained and cannot compare to newer engines
The EA888 3B is arguably one of the smoothest engines with great tuning potential if desired
I met a female driver of A4 who turned to Lexus is250 I think. She said the Audi A4 is crap!
